Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • Table
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Table
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class implements relational database tables (including attribute names, domains and a list of tuples. Five basic relational algebra operators are provided: project, select, union, minus join. The insert data manipulation operator is also provided. Missing are update and delete data manipulation operators.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • project

        public Table project(java.lang.String attributes)
        Project the tuples onto a lower dimension by keeping only the given attributes. Check whether the original key is included in the projection. #usage movie.project ("title year studioNo")
        Parameters:
        attributes - the attributes to project onto
        Returns:
        a table of projected tuples

      • select

        public Table select(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Comparable[]> predicate)
        Select the tuples satisfying the given predicate (Boolean function). #usage movie.select (t ->> t[movie.col("year")].equals (1977))
        Parameters:
        predicate - the check condition for tuples
        Returns:
        a table with tuples satisfying the predicate

      • select

        public Table select(KeyType keyVal)
        Select the tuples satisfying the given key predicate (key = value). Use an index (Map) to retrieve the tuple with the given key value.
        Parameters:
        keyVal - the given key value
        Returns:
        a table with the tuple satisfying the key predicate

      • union

        public Table union(Table table2)
        Union this table and table2. Check that the two tables are compatible. #usage movie.union (show)
        Parameters:
        table2 - the rhs table in the union operation
        Returns:
        a table representing the union

      • minus

        public Table minus(Table table2)
        Take the difference of this table and table2. Check that the two tables are compatible. #usage movie.minus (show)
        Parameters:
        table2 - The rhs table in the minus operation
        Returns:
        a table representing the difference

      • join

        public Table join(java.lang.String attributes1,
                  java.lang.String attributes2,
                  Table table2)
        Join this table and table2 by performing an equijoin. Tuples from both tables are compared requiring attributes1 to equal attributes2. Disambiguate attribute names by append "2" to the end of any duplicate attribute name. #usage movie.join ("studioNo", "name", studio) #usage movieStar.join ("name == s.name", starsIn)
        Parameters:
        attribute1 - the attributes of this table to be compared (Foreign Key)
        attribute2 - the attributes of table2 to be compared (Primary Key)
        table2 - the rhs table in the join operation
        Returns:
        a table with tuples satisfying the equality predicate

      • col

        public int col(java.lang.String attr)
        Return the column position for the given attribute name.
        Parameters:
        attr - the given attribute name
        Returns:
        a column position

      • insert

        public boolean insert(java.lang.Comparable[] tup)
        Insert a tuple to the table. #usage movie.insert ("'Star_Wars'", 1977, 124, "T", "Fox", 12345)
        Parameters:
        tup - the array of attribute values forming the tuple
        Returns:
        whether insertion was successful

        Determine whether the two tables (this and table2) are compatible, i.e., have the same number of attributes each with the same corresponding domain.
        Parameters:
        table2 - the rhs table
        Returns:
        whether the two tables are compatible

      • match

        private int[] match(java.lang.String[] column)
        Match the column and attribute names to determine the domains.
        Parameters:
        column - the array of column names
        Returns:
        an array of column index positions

      • extract

        private java.lang.Comparable[] extract(java.lang.Comparable[] t,
                                       java.lang.String[] column)
        Extract the attributes specified by the column array from tuple t.
        Parameters:
        t - the tuple to extract from
        column - the array of column names
        Returns:
        a smaller tuple extracted from tuple t

      • typeCheck

        private boolean typeCheck(java.lang.Comparable[] t)
        Check the size of the tuple (number of elements in list) as well as the type of each value to ensure it is from the right domain.
        Parameters:
        t - the tuple as a list of attribute values
        Returns:
        whether the tuple has the right size and values that comply with the given domains

      • findClass

        private static java.lang.Class[] findClass(java.lang.String[] className)
        Find the classes in the "java.lang" package with given names.
        Parameters:
        className - the array of class name (e.g., {"Integer", "String"})
        Returns:
        an array of Java classes

      • extractDom

        private java.lang.Class[] extractDom(int[] colPos,
                                     java.lang.Class[] group)
        Extract the corresponding domains.
        Parameters:
        colPos - the column positions to extract.
        group - where to extract from
        Returns:
        the extracted domains
